oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sounds Of Yesterday radio program - Bob Wills
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Radio program titled the Sounds Of Yesterday, featuring Ray Campi (host/narrator) and Bob Wills (performer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bob Wills; Texas Playboys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) [Unidentified] introduces Ray Campi and the program -- (00:07) Opening theme and statement -- (00:25) Roly Poly (Bob Wills and his Texas Playboys) -- (01:10) Ray Campi talks about Bob Wills recording for Columbia in the 1940s, and introduces a recording of an interview with Dewey Groom and Bob Wills -- (01:42) Dewey Groom asks Wills about the first fiddle tune he ever played -- (01:49) Bob Wills talks about the exact moment and setting of his first fiddle tune -- (02:57) [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- (03:18) Closing statements (Ray Campi) -- (03:32) Closing tags ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wills, Bob, 1905-1975; Texas Playboys; Campi, Ray
